author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body: Can you add some compatibility constraints? See https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/

Hi Fredrik,

I have updated the compact constraints in the project.toml. Do I need to
initialize a new pull request for the new commit?

Hao

On Wed, May 1, 2019 at 5:19 PM Fredrik Ekre <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Can you add some compatibility constraints? See
> https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/v1/compatibility/
>
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/482#issuecomment-488433337>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AFM2EASGICUVZQ7HHUIC4CLPTICOJANCNFSM4HJUYN3A>
> .
>


-- 
Hao Wu
University of Michigan
Department of Mathematics
You can just retrigger the bot and this PR will be updated.

Consider enabling TagBot to make sure the release is persistent in your repo, see https://discourse.julialang.org/t/ann-tagbot-creates-tags-and-releases-for-your-julia-packages-when-theyre-registered/23084
